Thanks @modestproposal1.  Open to the debate about taxes - lets just ground this carried interest conversation in some reality.
12/ HFs and VC who pay lower rates do so b/c of the preferred rate of LT Cap Gains. Eliminate LT Cap Gains and you eliminate the preference.
11/ for all those reporting on this, please somebody post a single tax form with the words carried interest tax rate - it does not exist.
10/ but hard to tolerate all of this nonsense about carried interest which is just duping people.
9/ all cards on the table, I don't like excessive taxes b/c I think people do better with money than government.
8/ but it will increase taxes on VC Partners, Real Estate Partnerships, etc whose carried interest is almost all LT Gains taxed at ~ 30%.
7/ thus, eliminating carried interest will NOT increase taxes on most hedge funds b/c they already pay ST cap gains rate which is > 50%.
6/ there is no such thing as a carried interest tax rate. it is either LT, ST, Dividend, or Interest.  the rate is determined by composition
5/ if, like many VC firms, the character of the gain associated with the carried interest is 100% LT Cap Gains, then the tax rate = ~ 30%
4/ if, like many hedge funds, the character of the gain associated with the carried interest is 100% ST Cap Gains, then the tax rate = > 50%
3/ carried interest is taxed at the rate associated with the underlying interest the manager is granted for their sweat equity.
2/ looks like carried interest will be THE issue of the upcoming election.  as it should be - can't think of anything more important :)
